title: Calories in Fried Chicken Breast
meta_description: Discover calories in fried chicken breast, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown per serving, and easy tweaks for healthier options.
assumptions: Skinless, breaded, deep-fried in vegetable oil; medium size (~120 g cooked weight); no additional sauces.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by breading type, oil used, frying time, portion size, and brand; check labels or recipes for precision.

quick_answer.text: One fried chicken breast contains about 290 kcal, 25 g protein, and 15 g fat.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in one fried chicken breast?
faqs.a: Approximately 290 kcal for a medium, breaded, deep-fried skinless breast.

faqs.q: What's the protein in fried chicken breast?
faqs.a: About 25 g protein per serving, making it a good high-protein option.

faqs.q: Does frying add a lot of fat to chicken breast?
faqs.a: Yes, deep-frying adds ~15 g fat per breast, mostly from absorbed oil.

faqs.q: How do calories compare to grilled chicken breast?
faqs.a: Fried is higher (~290 kcal) vs. grilled (~165 kcal per 120 g) due to breading and oil.

faqs.q: Is fried chicken breast high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, around 700 mg per breast from breading and seasoning; watch if on low-sodium diet.
